title: Intern, Corporate Social Responsibility
description:
About Us

CapitaLand Group (CapitaLand) is one of Asia’s largest diversified real estate groups. Headquartered in Singapore, CapitaLand’s portfolio focuses on real estate investment management and real estate development, and spans across more than 270 cities in over 45 countries.

Job Description

At CapitaLand, we believe in making a positive impact by building resilience through enriching lives and uplifting communities where we operate. CapitaLand Hope Foundation (CHF), the philanthropic arm of CapitaLand Group, was established in 2005 to deepen the company’s community development commitment and contribute towards education, health and well-being initiatives targeting children, youth and seniors. Going beyond donations, the company also advocates volunteerism as an integral part of building a caring and inclusive community. We actively leverage our resources and networks to galvanise our staff, business partners and tenants to build an ecosystem of doing good together, amplifying the direct impact of our contributions to the communities.

The Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) Intern will be part of the Group CSR Team to work with like-minded individuals to drive social impact across CapitaLand Group of businesses as part of our global efforts to be an advocate for the social causes that we are passionate about.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

* Assist in the in the planning and execution of CSR/CHF initiatives in Singapore, including the coordination with internal stakeholders, community partners and volunteers in programme design, ensuring alignment with funding focus areas, and tracking programme outcomes during implementation
* Assist in the implementation of business improvement initiatives including digitalisation of business processes, data cleaning and management
* Assist in the content development, design and management of CSR/CHF communications materials such as videos, website, intranet, promotional literature, EDMs and presentation slides, as well as support the collection of impact stories to drive social awareness and support for the causes
* Assist with CSR/CHF report preparation including data collection and analysis
* Any duties assigned

Do you have what it takes?

* Team player with good communication, interpersonal and organisation skills
* Curious, resourceful and meticulous with good analytical skills and ability to multitask and manage multiple timelines independently
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills with good command of English. Knowledge of Chinese language will be advantageous when liaising with stakeholders in China if required
* Good digital media and IT knowledge and skills such as basic design tool and MS Office – Word, Excel and Powerpoint, and able to create good presentation content for reporting and storytelling
* Great project and event management experience and skills will be useful
* Strong interest in CSR and community development with some community service experience will be beneficial
* Able to commit for at least 6 months for the internship will be preferred

Closing Statement:

At CapitaLand, we advocate fair employment practices, and recruit talents based on merit and fit with our Corporate values. We provide equal opportunity for all qualified persons and build an inclusive workplace regardless of race, gender, age, religious belief or nationality.

Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Senior Research Fellow (Climate Finance)
description:
Nanyang Business School (NBS) invites applications for the position of Senior Research Fellow (Post-doc) with Prof. Xin Chang’s research group. This position is supported by a Tier III grant to establish a Climate Transformation Programme (CTP) at NTU. As part of this programme, the Climate Finance Cluster will assess the multifaceted business risks posed by the physical impacts of climate change, evaluate the implications of carbon pricing and public procurement, and facilitate the transition to a low-carbon economy.

The Senior Research Fellow will be responsible for developing integrated approaches to assess company-level climate risks, assembling datasets on mandatory carbon pricing and government procurement, and incorporating these resources into empirical analyses of financial markets and economic outcomes. The researcher will contribute to advancing how climate risks are measured, priced, and managed by companies and investors, and will see this work through to publication in major research journals.

Duties and Responsibilities:

* Lead the development of company-level climate risk measures and related analytical frameworks, including the construction of databases, regional climate-risk summaries, and empirical models that incorporate climate risk into asset-pricing applications.
* Quantify the economic and financial impacts of mandatory carbon pricing and government procurement policies on firms and markets.
* Perform data management, large-scale statistical analyses, and ensure high standards of documentation and reproducibility.
* Work effectively with colleagues across the CTP and with local and international collaborators.
* Mentor junior colleagues and students.
* Write, present, and publish research findings in peer-reviewed journals.

Knowledge and Experience Requirements:

* PhD degree in statistics, computer sciences, economics, or a closely related field.
* Excellent knowledge of computational linguistic tools and machine learning techniques.
* Experience with data analysis with Python and STATA.
* Prior experience in publishing in peer-reviewed business, economic, or scientific journals
* Excellent oral and written communication skills in English.

Key Competency Requirements:

* Ability to work independently to develop research in challenging environments.
* Collaborative, with an interest in working with other researchers and scientists (this is a large team project) to produce high-quality and impactful research.
* Interest in climate, green, or sustainable finance.
* Excellent oral and written communication skills.

Interested applicants are invited to submit a cover letter, full CV and names and contact details of three referees in one document. Enquiries about this position can be made to Nur Masturah (nurmasturah.am@ntu.edu.sg).

We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

title: Human Rights Compliance Specialist , Human Rights and Social Impact
description:
**DESCRIPTION**
---------------

Join us at the edge of Amazon's sustainability initiatives to work on environmental and social advancements to support Amazon's long term worldwide sustainability strategy. At Amazon, we're working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people.  
  
The Worldwide Sustainability (WWS) organization capitalizes on Amazon’s scale and speed to build a more resilient and sustainable company. We manage our social and environmental impacts globally, and drive solutions that enable our customers, businesses, and the world to become more sustainable.  
  
Amazon's Human Rights & Social Impact (HRSI) program drives customer trust, business continuity, and sustainable social impact by embedding respect for human rights and the environment throughout Amazon’s entire value chain. We implement company-wide standards and commitments such as our Global Human Rights Principles (GHRP) and Supply Chain Standards (SCS). We seek to continuously improve the tools and processes used in integrating human rights and environmental due diligence across the business.  
  
The Human Rights Compliance Specialist manages actual human rights and environmental impacts within APJC and India. This role combines technical human rights expertise with remediation design and oversight, investigation coordination, stakeholder management, and analytical problem-solving to ensure effective resolution of cases while maintaining rigorous documentation and data integrity standards. The role encompasses the full lifecycle of impact management: investigation, corrective action, remedy, and stakeholder response coordination.
  
  
Key job responsibilities  
The Human Rights Compliance Specialist manages straightforward remediation cases following established frameworks and standard operating procedures. They work directly with suppliers and vendors to provide coaching on remediation, guiding them through corrective action processes and helping implement both immediate fixes and long-term preventative measures. They gather and verify evidence that audit findings are resolved, conducting site visits when necessary to provide on-site guidance and assess remediation progress.
  
  
They apply established guidance and templates to case management, escalating to Human Rights Compliance Managers or Regional Remediation Leads when cases require interpretation of ambiguous policy or involve novel situations. They document case activities comprehensively in case management systems, maintaining data integrity and following standardized documentation protocols. They contribute feedback to SOPs and guidance materials based on their operational experience, helping ensure consistent remediation approaches across suppliers and vendors.
  
  
The Human Rights Compliance Specialist coordinates with business units and cross-functional stakeholders to facilitate progress on remediation activities, identifying blockers and escalating appropriately. They participate in training programs to build human rights expertise, including audit shadowing opportunities and skills development initiatives. They learn to identify patterns across their caseload and flag potential trending issues to more senior team members for analysis.
  
  
About the team  
About the team  
  
Diverse Experiences:  
World Wide Sustainability (WWS) values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.  
  
Inclusive Team Culture:  
It’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.  
  
Mentorship & Career Growth:  
We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.  
  
Work/Life Balance:  
We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why flexible work hours and arrangements are part of our culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve.

**BASIC QUALIFICATIONS**
------------------------

* 2+ years of relevant experience in human rights, supply chain responsibility, compliance, audit, or related field
* Understanding of human rights principles and labor standards
* Willingness to travel for supplier site visits as needed

**PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS**
----------------------------

* Experience with supplier audits, compliance programs, or issue resolution
* Knowledge of international labor standards (ILO conventions, UN Guiding Principles)
* Familiarity with case management systems or tracking tools
* Experience in manufacturing, supply chain, or operations environments
* Multilingual capabilities relevant to supplier regions
* Bachelor's degree in relevant field (human rights, international relations, business, etc.)

  
Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

title: Director, Earth & Environment
description:
Summary

WSP is seeking an experienced and visionary candidate to lead and expand its environmental services portfolio as Director, Earth & Environment. The role involves providing strategic direction, overseeing multidisciplinary environmental projects, acting as a technical advisor, fostering client relationships, driving business development, managing financial performance, and mentoring a team of environmental professionals. The director will ensure compliance with environmental legislation and quality standards.

Must Have
• Provide strategic direction and leadership for Earth & Environment Business line specialising in Environmental Consulting & Management services
• Oversee the delivery of multidisciplinary environmental projects (e.g., Occupational and Environmental Health & Safety, EIAs, ESIA, Carbon/decarbonisation advisory)
• Act as a key technical advisor and thought leader within the business and industry
• Foster and grow relationships with clients, regulators, government bodies, and stakeholders
• Drive business development, proposal writing, and tender submissions to secure new opportunities
• Manage financial performance of the environmental team, including budgeting, forecasting, and profitability
• Mentor and lead a team of environmental professionals to achieve high-quality outcomes and professional development
• Ensure projects comply with relevant environmental legislation, best practices, and internal quality standards
• Be a Chartered Member of an institution or equivalent recognised in Singapore and internationally
• Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Environmental Science, Chemical Engineering, Civil Engineering, Water Resources, Environmental Management or related field
• Minimum of 12–15 years of relevant consulting experience
• At least 5 years in a senior leadership role
• Proven track record of managing large-scale environmental projects across sectors
• Strong commercial acumen and business development skills
• Exceptional communication and stakeholder engagement skills
• In-depth understanding of Singapore and other international environmental regulations and sustainability frameworks

Good To Have
• Experience with providing Occupational and Environmental health and Safety, Environmental, Health & safety services, Environmental consulting and management services in Singapore as well internationally
• Ability to collaborate across multi-disciplinary teams where required
• Familiarity with digital tools in environmental assessment analytics, modelling, and reporting

WSP is dedicated to delivering sustainable solutions in the Built Environment, Infrastructure, Power, Water/ Wastewater, Waste, Climate resilience and Environmental Consulting and Management services. With a growing client base in both public and private sectors, we are committed to shaping a more resilient and environmentally responsible future.

We are seeking an experienced and visionary candidate to lead and expand our environmental services portfolio. The ideal candidate will bring deep expertise in environmental consulting and management services, along with exceptional leadership, client relationship, and strategic planning capabilities.
Key Responsibilities
• Provide strategic direction and leadership for Earth & Environment Business line specialising in Environmental Consulting & Management services
• Oversee the delivery of multidisciplinary environmental projects in areas such as but not limited to Occupational and Environmental Health & Safety services, Environmental Health & Safety services, Environmental Impact Assessments and Environmental Site Assessments, Environmental and Social Impact Assessments, Carbon/ decarbonisation advisory services, environmental sustainability assessments and advisory services
• Act as a key technical advisor and thought leader within the business and industry
• Foster and grow relationships with clients, regulators, government bodies, and stakeholders
• Drive business development, proposal writing, and tender submissions to secure new opportunities
• Manage financial performance of the environmental team, including budgeting, forecasting, and profitability
• Mentor and lead a team of environmental professionals to achieve high-quality outcomes and professional development
• Ensure projects comply with relevant environmental legislation, best practices, and internal quality standards
Requirements
• Be a Chartered Member of an institution or equivalent recognised in Singapore and internationally e.g. Chartered Institution of Water and Environmental Management (CIWEM), Society for the Environment (SocEnv), Certified Environmental Practitioner (CEnvP)
• Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Environmental Science, Chemical Engineering, Civil Engineering, Water Resources, Environmental Management or related field
• Minimum of 12–15 years of relevant consulting experience, with at least 5 years in a senior leadership role
• Proven track record of managing large-scale environmental projects across sectors
• Strong commercial acumen and business development skills
• Exceptional communication and stakeholder engagement skills
• In-depth understanding of Singapore and other international environmental regulations and sustainability frameworks (depending on location)
Preferred Skills
• Experience with providing Occupational and Environmental health and Safety, Environmental, Health & safety services, Environmental consulting and management services in Singapore as well internationally (an advantage)
• Ability to collaborate across multi-disciplinary teams where required
• Familiarity with digital tools in environmental assessment analytics, modelling, and reporting
Self-Development
• Take the lead to establish personal career experiences, development and performance goals through regular and relevant conversations within the professional community
• Keep up-to-date with developments in your professional area
• Make use of expert collaboration opportunities to develop and maintain a network of technical/professional support and excellence
• Achieve and/or maintain professional registrations/licences relevant to your role
• Update the Capabilities Database for sharing capabilities and qualifications within the business
• Regularly reflect on the contribution you make to your team culture to embrace diversity, strive for excellence and demonstrate our Guiding Principles
